simple: I’m a Christian, first-generation immigrant, and the youngest in a family of five! I recently graduated from UC Santa Cruz with a B.S. in Computer Science. During my time in college, I focused on software and full-stack web development, working on several projects for various courses, from a study tool to a data visualization dashboard for the UC Santa Cruz Police. I also had the opportunity to work with WordPress websites through jobs and internships.

Additionally, my other job experiences have helped develop my non-technical skills. For example, my time as a LSS tutor has developed my interpersonal skills needed to work as a good team member. Right now, I’m hoping to work in the public sector, so I can utilize my skills for others!

Description.Text: The course addressed principal project management, product engineering, and collaborative aspects of software development as a team enterprise.
Learned concepts, practices, and tools widely used in the software industry by small teams in the development of software products (or systems with a significant software component).
Applied the concepts, practices, and tools introduced in a course-long software project as a member of a self-organized team of five students.
Course topics included project plannning and management, agile engineering practices, system design principles, and quality assurance concepts

e115a.ImageAlt: Flashcard Creation Page of Rapid Review, the group project for this course

Description.Text: Led a team to specify, design, construct, test, and document the Crime Visualization Dashboard's software system in the criminal justice and public safety application domain
Participated in weekly technical discussions and ongoing design reviews
Formally presented and demonstrated final project results to faculty staff and project sponsor

e115bc.ImageAlt: Title slide of the final project presentation, detailing the project name, group members, and sponsors

Description.Text: An introduction to machine learning algorithms and their applications
Topics included classification learning, density estimation and Bayesian learning regression, and online learning
Provided an introduction to standard learning methods such as neural networks, decision trees, boosting, and nearest neighbor techniques.

e142.ImageAlt: Graph showing the result of a k-means clustering algorithm on a set of 2D points

Description.Text: Examined current uses of the World Wide Web for delivery of the sophisticated interactive applications used daily
Built full-stack web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React.js (JSX), Material UI, Node.js, Express.js, and PostgreSQL
Designed and consumed RESTful APIs while applying MVC architecture and core server-development principles to create robust, maintainable application structures
Practiced test-driven development and implemented unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to achieve full code coverage, ensuring reliability and performance across the full stack
Applied responsive and accessible web design principles to deliver inclusive, mobile-friendly user experiences
Gained foundational knowledge of web application security, deployment considerations, and modern full-stack development workflows used in real-world, interactive web applications

e186.ImageAlt: Diligent, the final assignment of this course

Description.Text: Provided me with Python programming skills and the ability to design programs and read Python code
Topics included data types, control flow, methods and advanced functions, built-in data structures, and introduction to OOP.
Introduction to software development in Python focusing on structuring software in terms of objects endowed with primitive operations.
Introduced concepts and techniques via a sequence of concrete case studies.
Coursework consisted of programming assignments and a final examination.

e30.ImageAlt: A rose curve generated in python

Description.Text: Contributed to WordPress projects using the Elementor plugin, including creating a section of a campaign landing page and finalizing the design of a volunteering website
Participated in twice-weekly meetings where I provided regular progress updates to the project lead and CEO and received new tasks

ean.ImageAlt: Hero image for a promotional campaign by the Ark Network Group

Description.Text: Migrated 61 pages from the police department's legacy website to a new WordPress version
Enhanced website usability and visual quality by restructuring navigation menus, updating outdated page content, fixing broken links, and adding higher-quality images

Ensured website met the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 by adding alt-text to appropriate images, improving keyboard and page-reader navigation, and overhauling the header structure in each page
Streamlined future website maintenance by utilizing page templates and patterns for the website design
Trained a successor in managing the website, including how to add and modify content to new and existing pages
Met with the Chief of Police weekly to ensure the website development stayed consistent with the Police Department's vision and mission

epd.ImageAlt: Homepage of the UC Santa Cruz Police Department's website

BulletPoints: Led a team of three to finalize a data dashboard transforming UCSC crime data into insights for improved police resource deployment and public transparency, using a Node.js server to process data to a Power BI-run dashboard
Implemented server-side improvements including authorization for endpoints, data validation algorithms for geolocation data, and a testing framework with comprehensive test coverage
Held a beta testing phase by planning, coordinating, and incorporating user feedback to enhance dashboard functionality and user experience
pcvd.Description: This dashboard transforms crime data into visualizations that enable the UC Santa Cruz Police to make data-driven policing strategies and increases crime awareness in the public.
pcvd.EmbedElementAlt: Cases section of the crime visualization dashboard
pcvd.ImageAlt: Group picture of the student developers and UC Santa Cruz Police staff
pcvd.Name: Crime Visualization Dashboard

Overview.RelatedOrganization: Associated with UC Santa Cruz Police Department

BulletPoints: Features include workspaces, channels, messaging, role-based access, and persistent user sessions
Implemented a RESTful API server with Node.js/Express and designed a PostgreSQL relational database to manage users, workspaces, channels, messages, permissions, and session persistence

Built a fully interactive React.js frontend featuring authentication, workspace/channel navigation, day-grouped messages, real-time UI updates, responsive layouts, persistent last-visited state, and accessibility-conscious interface patterns.
Added workspace administration features—including workspace creation, channel creation, and teammate management—secured by ownership and permission logic enforced on both client and server.
Achieved over 95% code coverage through comprehensive unit, integration, and end-to-end tests across the frontend and backend, ensuring robustness, correctness, and reliable error handling.
pdiligent.Description: Diligent is a Slack style messaging system and a single page, full stack web application using the NERP stack: Node.js, Express, React, and PostgreSQL, plus Material-UI. I developed this application over the course of eight days as the final cumulative project of the full stack web development class
pdiligent.EmbedElementAlt: Two chat message pages of Diligent
pdiligent.ImageAlt: UC Santa Cruz Athletics Logo, also used for the logo of Diligent
pdiligent.Name: Diligent

Overview.RelatedOrganization: Associated with Full Stack Development Course

BulletPoints: Created a full-stack web application enabling users to create flashcards and generate practice tests for efficient studying and self-assessment, running frontend on Vercel, backend on Render, and data storage on Firebase
Created a full-stack web application enabling users to create flashcards and generate practice tests for efficient studying and self-assessment, using React framework and MUI components
Built components for a React.js front-end enabling users to create flashcards and generate practice tests for efficient studying and self-assessment in a sleek and minimalistic user interface
Architected backend framework, designed Firebase database structure, and integrated AI-powered answer generation to enhance test creation
Developed and maintained backend test suite to ensure code reliability and robust functionality.

Developed an Express server with RESTful API endpoints that are validated using OpenAPI and tested through SwaggerUI and Suptertest/Jest test suites, ensuring reliability and seamless frontend-backend communication via JSON

Developed an ExpressJS server with RESTful API endpoints that are validated using OpenAPI and tested through SwaggerUI and Supertest/Jest test suites, ensuring reliability and seamless frontend-backend communication
Employed Scrum methodologies and git version control throughout development, ensuring both project deadlines and code quality were maintained
Employed Scrum methods and git version control throughout development, ensuring the five-person team maintained project deadlines and high code quality
Designed and implemented a structured Firebase Realtime Database schema to efficiently store user-generated flashcards and study sets, ensuring scalability and fast read/write operations
Designed the structure of the Firebase Realtime Database and implemented API interactions to support efficient, scalable data storage for user-generated content

Engineered a rate-limited AI request queue using Redis and Bull to manage high volumes of test generation requests, preventing API overload while still integrating Llama for dynamic question and answer creation
Integrated Llama 3.2 into test generation for dynamic and relevant question and answer creation using OpenAI
prr.Description: Rapid Review is a full-stack study platform that lets users create flashcards and generate AI-powered practice tests through a clean React/MUI interface.
prr.EmbedElementAlt: Example of Home page in Rapid Review
prr.ImageAlt: Example of Quiz page in Rapid Review
prr.Name: Rapid Review

Overview.RelatedOrganization: Academic Project for UC Santa Cruz Course
Overview.Role: Lead Backend Developer and Product Owner
